instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: MacBook retina 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Dear friends

First, congratulations to Louis and his entire team.
Second, sorry, I don't speak English I use Google translation.

My problem.
Logic board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Retina <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
MagSafe light green / orange, ok.
The fans rotate at normal speed then slow down slightly then rotate normally, etc.
Watch this video:
[URL="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X869L6VVVRU&feature=youtu.be"]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X869...ature=youtu.be[/URL]
No dong, no display.
What should I check please?

Thanks for your help.

PS I did a complete reballing, no success

First of all, welcome to the forum!

Reballed what?
For this board, ALWAYS start resoldering <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> with leaded...

<CHIP>U8900</CHIP> (ISL62882C) replaced.
Always the breakdown.
An other idea ?

threads.title: MacBook retina 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
"PS I did a complete reballing"
Do you mean GPU reballed?

Post voltage on all big coils.
Do you get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: MacBook retina 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
Thank you for your help but I do not understand your request, I am not a super specialist.
All resistors, <RESISTOR>R2683</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R2687</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R2671</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R2681</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R2689</RESISTOR> are good.

threads.title: MacBook retina 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
You said something about "complete reballing".
Does this mean GPU reballing?
Board could be now screwed up.

I didn't ask about resistors value.
Just measure <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> voltage.

"Post voltage on all big coils."
Like L7220/60, L7330 and more...

L7220 = 0
L7260 = 3.34
L3895 = 0
L7770 = 0
L7030 = 12.60
L9830 = 0
L8360 = 0
L8310 = 0
L7720 = 0
L7630 = 0
L7100 = 0
L8930 = 0
L8960 = 0
L7560 = 0
L7550 = 0
L7510 = 0
L7520 = 0
L7530 = 0

Reballing on <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>.
I did 16 reballing on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B and all the logic boards worked again.

The orange magsafe but the computer not started.

Thank you very much

threads.title: MacBook retina 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
You expect video, but no voltages apart S5 ones...

No pulse at all on L7220, nor <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>?

Magsafe 2 85W charger for sure?
Check <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> level.

threads.title: MacBook retina 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
I replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5040</TRANSISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5041</RESISTOR>. No changes.
I recapitulate.
The fans start when the battery is connected and when I connect the MagSafe (60W)?
The fans are running well except that they slow down a little bit, a fraction of a second, and start up again and again without booting.
I can't turn off the fans using the keyboard, I have to unplug.
The fans do not start if the battery is not connected but it seems to me that this is normal.
It looks like the computer does not reach EFI.
Thanks for your help, it's nice but I don't want to monopolize your time.

threads.title: MacBook retina 15" <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2012 - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A
threads.message:
"I connect the MagSafe (60W)
-----------------
fans do not start if the battery is not connected"
This board only starts with 85W charger, if battery not connected.

You've posted all coils 0V, apart of S5 state.
How then the board starts and fans spin???
